newsitem.title: USA: Super Vision president surrenders shares.
newsitem.headline: Super Vision president surrenders shares.

text.p: Super Vision International Inc on Friday said that President Brett Kingstone voluntarily surrendered 2,891,870 Class B escrow shares to the company treasury as of March 31, 1997.
The shares had been placed in escrow in connection with the company's initial public offering in March 1994.

The shares were subject to release upon the achievement of certain earnings targets or Class A share bid prices. The escrow arrangement was due to expire as of December 31, 1998, if the targets had not been achieved.

Commenting on the transaction, Mr. Kingstone, who is also the founder of Super Vision, noted, "As our sales and earnings continue to grow, we wanted to assure a capitalization structure that more accurately reflected the true value of the company."
